statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Massachusetts 65, Oakland 56
article.story: PITTSBURGH (AP) -- James Life didn't miss a shot in scoring all 15 of his points in the first half and Massachusetts built leads of as many as 16 points before halftime in beating Oakland 65-56 on Friday. Gary Forbes also scored 15 points for Massachusetts, with Stephane Lasme getting 11 points and 14 rebounds -- or nine more rebounds than any Oakland player. Rashaun Freeman added 11 points. Life was 6-of-6 in the first half, with three 3-pointers, as the Minutemen (2-0) surged to a 20-8 lead seven minutes into the game and were not pushed by Oakland (2-1) after that in the round-robin game of the Colonial Athletic Association Classic. Life missed both of his shots in the second half. The teams are playing three games in three days in Pittsburgh, also facing No. 4 Pitt and Northeastern over the weekend. UMass made 15 of 22 shots in the first half, 6-of-8 from 3-point range, and Oakland couldn't keep up while making only 10 of 28 shots. Oakland trailed by as many as 22 points at 51-29 midway though the second half, and got to within 9 points in the final minute only by going on an 11-0 run. Shawn Hopes scored 17 points, Brandon Cassise had 13 and Derick Nelson scored 10 for Oakland, which plays Northeastern on Saturday. Massachusetts plays Pittsburgh in a matchup of teams that once played in the former Eastern Eight conference.
